message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the construction of regenerating codes, which are a type of coding theory used in distributed storage systems. The paper focuses on the construction of codes with a layered structure, which is a technique commonly used in information theory and coding theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with the performance of these codes in distributed storage systems, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the field size required for these codes, which is a computational aspect and falls under the sub-category of cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper discusses the construction of optimal codes with locality, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
